inference:
Let \(w\) be the width of the inner strip. Then, the width of the outer strip is \(w+2\). 

The area of the inner strip is 100:
$$w\cdot(5-2w)=100$$
$$5w-2w^2=100$$
$$2w^2-5w+100=0$$
$$(2w-20)(w-5)=0$$
$$w=10\space\text{or}\space w=5$$

Since \(w\) is the width of the inner strip, \(w=10\), which means that the width of the outer strip is \(w+2=10+2=12\).

The area of the outer strip is:
$$(5+12)\cdot(7+12)-100=140$$
$$17\cdot 19-100=140$$
$$323-100=140$$
Final Answer: \boxed{$140$}. I hope it is correct.
